projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

fields.summary: Windows: Items missing in parity report

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I'm not sure if this is a doc issue or a problem with the scripts we use to generate the parity report.

In any case, looking at http://builds.appcelerator.com/mobile/master/mobilesdk-6.0.0.v20160203193439-parity.html I'm seeing some APIs listed as unsupported though they really are:

- Global
- Modules.Cloud* (?)
- Titanium.BlobStream
- Titanium.BufferStream
- Titanium.Filesystem.FileStream
- Titanium.Map
- Titanium.Map.Annotation
- Titanium.Map.View
- Titanium.Module
- Titanium.Proxy
- Titanium.UI.AttributedString
- Titanium.UI.ListItem
- Titanium.UI.ListSection
- Titanium.UI.Picker
- Titanium.XML.CDATASection
- Titanium.XML.Comment
- Titanium.XML.DocumentFragment
- Titanium.XML.EntityReference
- Titanium.XML.Text
fields.summary: Windows: Update parity report generation/docs to show support for missing items

comments.body:
[~gmathews] Seems like only some of this "worked". (just the stream classes?)

These are all still showing as NO for http://builds.appcelerator.com/mobile/master/mobilesdk-6.0.0.v20160211081637-parity.html
- Global
- Modules.Cloud* (?)
- Titanium.Map
- Titanium.Map.Annotation
- Titanium.Map.View
- Titanium.Module
- Titanium.Proxy
- Titanium.UI.AttributedString
- Titanium.UI.ListItem
- Titanium.UI.ListSection
- Titanium.UI.Picker
- Titanium.XML.CDATASection
- Titanium.XML.Comment
- Titanium.XML.DocumentFragment
- Titanium.XML.EntityReference
- Titanium.XML.Text
I notice that too, I'll take a look as to why that is happening.
[~gmathews] Is this considered to be "fixed" by PR 564?

[~kota][~gmathews]I'm still seeing gaps in the parity report where we have classes but say we don't: http://builds.appcelerator.com/mobile/master/mobilesdk-5.4.0.v20160224050025-parity.html
- Titanium.UI.Picker
- Titanium.UI.ListItem
- Titanium.UI.AttributedString
- Titanium.Map
- Titanium.Map.Annotation
- Titanium.Map.View

[~cwilliams] Yes, this is because of http://studio-jenkins.appcelerator.org/job/titanium_mobile_windows_master/ not pulling the repository correctly.

http://studio-jenkins.appcelerator.org/job/titanium_mobile_windows_master/634/console

Shows that .yml files for those classes are not generated. Once that has been fixed this issue can be resolved. I would take a look myself, but I don't have access to the build server.

The windowsphone percentage in the parity report should be ~38%

Looks like this is some weird build server issue. The build is checking out the correct revision of the repo, but is not generating all the xml files we expect. I logged in and manually ran and saw the same odd behavior. I wiped the workspace and still saw the behavior. So now, I'm looking to see if maybe an outdated node is the cause of the issue on that machine?

Its on an ancient v0.10.13 build. I'm grabbing v4.4.3 now.

[~cwilliams] The parity report still appears to be missing the following from your comments:

* Titanium.UI.ListItem
* Titanium.UI.AttributedString
* ti.cloud module

Should I close this ticket and open a new one to address these?
